name: raccoon
text: ROCK ON SAMUEL CLEMENS! ROCK ON

name: rotating-dog
text: I cannot read "Samuel Clemens" anywhere without subconciously reciting "Clemens est servus".

name: andrew_k
text: Grumio was my favorite.

name: rotating-dog
text: All drunk in the kitchen, all seeing imaginary dogs

name: mnemodomi
text:
i have fond memories of the grumio/melissa/quintus/caecilius love rhombus

good thing vesuvius solved that problem... OR DID IT

name: westknife
text:
my high school latin club sold t-shirts based on the textbooks. one of them was caecilius on the front, and then on the back real big it said "EST PATER"

best one though was a picture of the slave-girl on the front (Melissa?) and then on the back it said "Grumio est laetissimus"

i am not making this up btw

name: akarroa
text: OMG my favorite was Grumio and that lion incident. By the way, our Latin Club shirts were banned for having the Nike' slogan in Latin: Fac id.

name: mnemodomi
text:
that is excellent. we just got a shirt with the colosseum and "LATIN ROCKS!" in script.

also yeah melissa est ancilla.

name: heccibiggs
text: Oh shit I read all these fuckers as well. Remember when Caecillius died? That bummed me out.

name: jamb23
text:
Oh yeah, Cerberus the dog loyally sitting beside Caecilius as the ash rained down. What a pro.

I remember being very disappointed by the next textbook though, the adventures of Quintus and Cogidubnus. Difficult second album syndrome.

name: prius_chaser
text: Mark Twain just invented Intercorn.

name: luckypyjamas
text: cornography?

name: sp1derbaby
text: Chubbied for simultaneously being both highbrow and lowbrow.

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by gothfae, Voretus, alejandroadam)

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked as spam and excluded. catachresis: What a douche. (reported by jstegall, gothfae, Magb)

text: A comment left by centipede_damascus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by johnnybaverage, straw, nighttoad, riotdejaneiro, pwb, tttt, Jesler729, GeyserShitdick, theoneyouwant, Connellingus, morypcaina, woodenteeth, TTAGXAMM, mediumrare, idsyen, last_tuesday, caddon, gorrioncita, Boredom_Man, usversusthem, Wolfslice, nathanielperson, mattylite, gnjdfsgk, aparrish)

name: idsyen
text: So for you the definition of music is tonality and/or melody? I think that Anton Webern might have issues with that.

name: gmm
text:
It's not though, is it? Unless it's some kind uber-minimalistcore stuff, you've got other instruments going on there.

Personally, I like hippedy-hop and rap just as much as I like music with guitars in.

Also chubby to Idsyen for the Anton Webern reference. I was going to make a John Cage joke myself but you pretty much covered the ground

name: molesticide
text: i could never figure out that dude's fatality.

name: molesticide
text: and seriously though hip hop is good, let us consider for a moment that the gentleman's voice IS the instrument, and that is all you need to know to appreciate it.  still, one is allowed his personal opinion.

name: wite_rabit
text: Chubbied - I like music with rocks in just as much as the rap/r&b.

name: morganization
text: i love how mark twain holds an ipod

name: epicurus
text: Rated 5 for panel 3.

name: cleave
text: Jim: You can't read so I'm not sure why I expect you to be able to know binary.

name: evolume
text: Blonde, Brunette, Redhead...

name: deusoma
text: You take that back! My mother is a saint!

name: fielding
text:
It looks kinda like it spells out "BARBER".

What does that say about me.

name: honesttom
text: That you and Pat should talk sometime?

name: fielding
text: Philippe and Ray.  Which of the two do you think explained "binary" to Mark Twain?

name: dasilodavi
text: I'll bet it was actually Eminem, busting out rhymes about binary and code that is hairy, and keeping track of bitches on his brand new blackberry.

name: ninjaein
text: You get a Chubby for that rhyme.

name: edwell
text: Neither. Twain had already gotten the idea from what Picard did with Data's head.

name: charchar
text: I love Ray adopting Twain's vernacular (e.g., "icebox").  Okay, i suppose one word does not a dialect make, but I can dream.

name: jthm_guitarist
text:
They should have given Twain some Rush.
"The space he invades gets by one you!"

name: kovatch
text:
" Eminem Reminds Me In many Ways of Tom And Huck"

Hahah Classic

name: beansdooma
text: Phillipe never does start school.

name: ham_shoes
text: Only Ray has the balls or ignorance to lie to Mark Twain.

name: clockworkorange
text:
In panel one, Ray demonstrates that he does not understand the concept of "time machine".

Or maybe Mark Twain is really dull and he's just inventing an excuse to leave.

name: squidvicious
text: I'm surprised nobody brought up the issue of Phillipe's purported schooling.

name: landowmpg
text:
Except for like, two posts above yours.

Also: How come no one seems able to spell Philippe's name!? It's in the dang strip!
